page.title: 03Aston Cantlow Church
page.content: In Aston Cantlow there is the parish church of St John the Baptist.There was a priest in Aston Cantlow in 1086 so the church is of Norman or Anglo Saxon origin. Notice the tower and the North West Turret. There are two square headed windows to the left of the North doorway, maybe 14th cent..A window at the east end of the north aisle is ancient.It may have been removed from the medieval chapel at Wilmcote.The priest's door and the great east window of the chancel plus the three southern chancel windows are 13th cent..The south wall and porch from the chancel to tower was taken down and reconstructed in 1850.The font is 15th cent., the bowl is octagonal with floral decoration.The tower has six bells.One is 15th cent.. Four are 17th cent.;the sixth was added in 1924.
